meanings.definition: The quality or state of being thin or slender.
meanings.sent1: The tenuousness of the thread made it easy to break.
meanings.sent2: The tenuousness of the rope was evident as it swayed in the wind.
meanings.sent3: The tenuousness of the spider's web was no match for the playful kitten.
meanings.sent4: The tenuousness of the ice's grip on the branch was a precarious situation.
meanings.sent5: The tenuousness of the model's figure was accentuated by the flowing dress.

meanings.definition: The quality or state of being weak or insubstantial.
meanings.sent1: The tenuousness of the argument was exposed by a simple question.
meanings.sent2: The tenuousness of the bridge's structure made crossing it nerve-wracking.
meanings.sent3: The tenuousness of the excuse was met with raised eyebrows.
meanings.sent4: The tenuousness of the relationship was evident in their lack of communication.
meanings.sent5: The tenuousness of the plan became apparent when it fell apart easily.

meanings.definition: The quality or state of being flimsy or fragile.
meanings.sent1: The tenuousness of the paper made it tear with a gentle touch.
meanings.sent2: The tenuousness of the glass made it shatter upon impact.
meanings.sent3: The tenuousness of the makeshift shelter was evident during the storm.
meanings.sent4: The tenuousness of the flower's petals made them fall at the slightest breeze.
meanings.sent5: The tenuousness of the old book's pages showed its age and delicacy.
